author: Staff Reporter
text:
Institutions must foster technology intensive administration for carrying out the works quick and quality, M.G. Sethuraman, Professor and Head of the Department of Chemistry, Gandhigram Rural Institute said on Friday.

Addressing a workshop on ‘Administrative Reforms’ for the teaching and non-teaching staff of Periyar University, organised by the Internal Quality Assurance Cell (IQAC), he gave an insights on the administrative reforms and said that technology should be adopted at the maximum for better results. He said that accountability and adequate efficiency in administration will enable proper functioning of the administration. The workshop was organised with the aim of promoting competence and liability in institutions particularly in administration and services, he added.

Earlier, IQAC coordinator S. Kannan, Professor and Head of the department of Zoology inaugurated the workshop. He said that administrative reforms have been a major concern of any institution across the world and success of any institution depends on doing the 'right thing' and also 'doing it right’. Almost all the institutions have got its own system and rules for administration. However, whether people follow it could only be ascertained with the individual’s disposition in working out his or her responsibility.
title: Workshop conducted
